attributes.comment:
I am opposed to the increase in fees as proposed in this rule. It places the
burden of the costs for unrelated services on the backs of primarily young
people in our country who are struggling to make ends meet and struggling to pay
the already horrendous cost of adoption on top of it. These are primarily
ordinary citizens with limited financial resources. Many are forced to secure
loans to bring a child into their family> This take years to pay off and limits
their spending for other goods and services until that is accomplished. The
process of asylum has nothing to do with adoption. This rule places undue burden
on a group of people who cannot afford it, on a group who seek to raise children
to serve our country and increase its well-being economically. Increasing the
financial obligations of this group to fund an unrelated government service is
wrong. A rule to require those seeking asylum to borrow money to contribute
would raise the outcry of "they do not have the money to pay it!" However, that
at least would put the burden on the people receiving the service. Don't charge
adoptive parents for services they do not receive. "They do not have the money
to pay it!"

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Alisanne R. Ells
